article.description: Lamonte Bearden scored 18 points with six assists, Blake Hamilton added 14 points and grabbed nine rebounds and Buffalo beat Ball State 76-64 on Tuesday night.
article.headline: Buffalo downs Ball State 76-64 behind Bearden
article.linkText: Buffalo downs Ball State 76-64 behind Bearden
article.story: BUFFALO, N.Y. -- Lamonte Bearden scored 18 points with six assists, Blake Hamilton added 14 points and grabbed nine rebounds and Buffalo beat Ball State 76-64 on Tuesday night. Jarryn Skeete and Willie Conner scored 12 apiece for the Bulls (11-9, 4-3 Mid-American Conference), who outscored the Cardinals 40-26 in the paint and scored 24 points on 19 Ball State turnovers. Leading by two at halftime, Buffalo pulled ahead on an 8-4 run and led 39-33 on Hamilton's 3-pointer. Skeete hit a 3 amid a 7-3 run and the Bulls led by 12, 52-40, with 10:46 left, but Ball State gained on a 10-2 run and pulled within 61-58 on Jeremiah Davis' 3-pointer with 5:49 left. Buffalo pulled away on a 10-1 run and the Cardinals got no closer than nine the rest of the way. Davis scored 13, Trey Moses added 11 and Bo Calhoun scored 11 and grabbed 12 rebounds for Ball State (13-7, 4-3).

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
